curam.util.persistence

Interface ContextContainer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContextContainerImpl

    public interface ContextContainer
    A Context Container for adding and retrieving context objects to be associated with Entities. Every PI entity has a unique ContextContainer. It can be obtained by calling the Entity.getContextContainer() method on the Entity. The ContextContainer methods can then be used to add and retrieve context objects associated with the Entity.
    Note that almost any object can be used as a context object, and added to an Entity's ContextContainer. However, the recommended practice is that bespoke "sidesaddle" Entity objects containing customer specific data should be used as context objects.
    Context objects are stored in the ContextContainer with the object type (i.e. class) as key - e.g. MyEntity.class.
    For parameterized types (e.g. List<MyEntity>), a Guice TypeLiteral must be used as key. This is because there is no way of getting a class for a parameterized type - i.e. MyEntity.class is possible, but List<MyEntity>.class is not. So, for example, to add a List<MyEntity> to a ContextContainer, use this code: 
     TypeLiteral<List<MyEntity>> myEntityListLiteral =
   new TypeLiteral<List<MyEntity>>() {};
 curamEntity.contextContainer().put(myEntityListLiteral, myEntityList);


    Notes:
    CRUD: Note that the context objects in an Entity's ContextContainer are not automatically Created, Read, Updated or Deleted in Persistent Storage with the Entity. Instead, in order to manage CRUD of context objects, please write event listeners that perform the operations, and register them for the appropriate events on the Entity.
    Implementation Restriction: This interface should not be implemented by external parties (e.g. customers).
    Since:
    5.2SP3

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean contains(java.lang.Class<?> contextClazz)
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not there is a context object associated with the supplied class in this ContextContainer.
      boolean contains(com.google.inject.TypeLiteral<?> contextTypeLiteral)
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not there is a context object associated with the supplied TypeLiteral in this ContextContainer.
      <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> contextClazz)
      Get the context object associated with the supplied context class in this ContextContainer.

      <T> T put(java.lang.Class<T> contextClazz, T contextObject)
      Put the supplied context object with the associated context class in this ContextContainer.

      Put the supplied context object with the associated context TypeLiteral in this ContextContainer.
      <T> T remove(java.lang.Class<T> contextClazz)
      Remove the context object associated with the supplied context class from this ContextContainer.
      <T> T remove(com.google.inject.TypeLiteral<T> contextTypeLiteral)
      Remove the context object associated with the supplied context TypeLiteral from this ContextContainer.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        boolean contains(java.lang.Class<?> contextClazz)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not there is a context object associated with the supplied class in this ContextContainer.
        Parameters:
        contextClazz - The class of the context object to be checked
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether or not there is a context object associated with the supplied class in the ContextContainer.

      • contains

        boolean contains(com.google.inject.TypeLiteral<?> contextTypeLiteral)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not there is a context object associated with the supplied TypeLiteral in this ContextContainer.
        Parameters:
        contextTypeLiteral - The TypeLiteral of the context object to be checked
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether or not there is a context object associated with the supplied TypeLiteral in the ContextContainer.

      • get

        <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> contextClazz)
        Get the context object associated with the supplied context class in this ContextContainer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the context
        Parameters:
        contextClazz - The class of the context
        Returns:
        The context object, or null if there is no context object for the supplied class.

      • get

        <T> T get(com.google.inject.TypeLiteral<T> contextTypeLiteral)
        Get the context object associated with the supplied context TypeLiteral in this ContextContainer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the context
        Parameters:
        contextTypeLiteral - The TypeLiteral of the context
        Returns:
        The context object, or null if there is no context object for the supplied TypeLiteral.

      • put

        <T> T put(java.lang.Class<T> contextClazz,
          T contextObject)
        Put the supplied context object with the associated context class in this ContextContainer.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the context
        Parameters:
        contextClazz - The class of the context
        contextObject - The context object to add
        Returns:
        The previous context object associated with the context class, or null if there was no context object associated with the context class.
